intro: Calanthe triplicata var. angraeciflora, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a species native to Madagascar and belongs to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid with a pseudobulb and linear leaves. It prefers shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
